intro: Sphaeranthus lecomteanus, commonly known as the Lecomte's globe flower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils in pine flatwoods and wetlands. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in spherical heads, giving it its common name. It is an herbaceous perennial that blooms from late spring to early summer.
